quotes: You can add or remove information on your profile, and you can also disable your account.
We collect information when you use our Services, like when you create an account, post content, or use our messaging features.
If you choose to delete your account, we will delete your content, but we may keep some information for legal reasons or to prevent harm.
We may share information with third-party partners for business purposes, such as providing joint services or helping us market our services.

We comply with legal requests from law enforcement and other public authorities. We may also share information if we believe it's necessary to protect the rights, property, and safety of Instagram, our users, or others.
You can control who sees your content and adjust your privacy settings through your account settings.
We work hard to protect your account using technological measures to prevent unauthorized access, and we regularly review our security measures.
We may change our terms of service, and if we do, we will let you know by posting an announcement on Instagram or sending you a message.
We aim to be clear about how our services work and about the information we collect, so that you can make informed decisions.
You own the content you create, and you can control how it's shared through your privacy settings.

metadata.additional_notes: The Terms & Conditions text shows a moderate level of GDPR compliance, with some areas requiring improvement, such as data sharing and data deletion.
